document_data.name: Spider
document_data.refs1e: {{Cite dragon/60/More Cantrips: Mini-spells for apprentice magic-users|19}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''Spider''''' was a personal [[cantrip]] that acolyte [[wizard]]s could learn.{{Cite dragon/59/Cantrips: Minor magics for would-be wizards|6}} It summoned a common, normal-sized [[spider]] to a nearby location chosen by the caster.
document_data.Effects: This cantrip conjured a single common spider. It appeared at a spot within {{SI|10|ft|long=yes}}The original description of this spell in [[Dragon magazine 60|''Dragon'' #60]] used the 1{{st}}-edition nomenclature 1", meaning {{SI|10|ft}} indoors and {{SI|10|yd}} outdoors. This was simplified to the shorter range in ''[[Wizard's Spell Compendium Volume Four]]''. of the caster and arrived in an irritated state. If summoned upon a living creature, the spider immediately tried to bite, distracting the target for a few seconds. There was a slight chance that the conjured spider was venomous, in which case the target took minimal damage and had a chance to resist, or else fall ill for a few days. The effects of spider venom could be reduced with ''[[slow poison]]'' or removed with ''[[neutralize poison]]''.
document_data.Components: This cantrip required [[verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s to cast. The caster spoke the word "arachnid" while wiggling their fingers like the legs of a crawling spider.
